intro: Crepis monticola, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its small, dandelion-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and often lobed, adapted to withstand harsh weather conditions. Crepis monticola plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying alpine flora.
